title: Watch: Indian Community's Big Welcome For PM Modi As He Lands In Moscow
content: Hundreds of people, including from the vibrant Indian community in Russia, lined up on both sides of the road as Prime Minister Narendra Modi travelled from the airport to his hotel in Moscow, on Monday.
summary: Hundreds of people, including from the vibrant Indian community in Russia, lined up on both sides of the road as Prime Minister Narendra Modi travelled from the airport to his hotel in Moscow, on Monday.

title: Ammunition Vending Machines Appear In US Stores Amid Increasing Gun Violence
content: There is no limitation on the quantity of ammunition customers can purchase and the vending machines would be restocked every two to four weeks.
summary: There is no limitation on the quantity of ammunition customers can purchase and the vending machines would be restocked every two to four weeks.

title: PM Modi Arrives In Russia To Hold Summit Talks With Putin
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived here on Monday on a two-day high-profile visit to Russia during which he will hold summit talks with President Vladimir Putin to review all aspects of bilateral ties and explore opportunities to further boost coop
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived here on Monday on a two-day high-profile visit to Russia during which he will hold summit talks with President Vladimir Putin to review all aspects of bilateral ties and explore opportunities to further boost coop

title: Australian Woman Loses Unborn Baby, Dies Days Later After Severe Headaches
content: On June 24, she was declared brain dead and her life support was removed.
summary: On June 24, she was declared brain dead and her life support was removed.

title: Pistols With Which Napoleon Intended To Kill Himself Sold For $1.8 Million
content: Two pistols that Napoleon Bonaparte once intended to use to kill himself were sold in France on Sunday for 1.69 million euros ($1.8 million), the auction house said, with the government insisting that they stay in the country as national treasures.
summary: Two pistols that Napoleon Bonaparte once intended to use to kill himself were sold in France on Sunday for 1.69 million euros ($1.8 million), the auction house said, with the government insisting that they stay in the country as national treasures.

title: As PM Embarks On Russia Trip, His 2-Decade Old Photo With Putin Surfaces
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday embarked on a two-day visit to Russia, for the 22nd India-Russia Annual Summit.
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday embarked on a two-day visit to Russia, for the 22nd India-Russia Annual Summit.

title: Opinion: US, UK, France, Iran: Why Are People Done With Their Governments?
content: From Joe Biden to Emmanuel Macron, politicians are scrambling to sustain support as new entrants make inroads into constituencies that have lost faith in the established order.
summary: From Joe Biden to Emmanuel Macron, politicians are scrambling to sustain support as new entrants make inroads into constituencies that have lost faith in the established order.

title: 20 Killed, Children's Hospital Smashed In Russian Strikes On Ukraine
content: Russia launched dozens of missiles at cities across Ukraine on Monday in an attack that killed at least 20 people and smashed into a children's hospital in Kyiv, officials said.
summary: Russia launched dozens of missiles at cities across Ukraine on Monday in an attack that killed at least 20 people and smashed into a children's hospital in Kyiv, officials said.

title: Explained: How A Few Days In Space Can Change The Biology Of Astronauts
content: Only about 600 people have ever travelled to space. The vast majority of astronauts over the past six decades have been middle-aged men on short-duration missions of fewer than 20 days.
summary: Only about 600 people have ever travelled to space. The vast majority of astronauts over the past six decades have been middle-aged men on short-duration missions of fewer than 20 days.

title: 6,500 Gold Bars Stolen In Canada's Biggest Heist Maybe In India, Say Cops
content: The incident, considered the biggest old heist in Canada's history, occurred at the Pearson International Airport in Toronto last April.
summary: The incident, considered the biggest old heist in Canada's history, occurred at the Pearson International Airport in Toronto last April.

title: Boeing Agrees To Plead Guilty To Fraud In Probe Into 737 MAX Crashes
content: Boeing said Monday it had reached a deal with the US Department of Justice over two fatal 737 MAX crashes, which court papers show would see the aviation giant plead guilty to fraud.
summary: Boeing said Monday it had reached a deal with the US Department of Justice over two fatal 737 MAX crashes, which court papers show would see the aviation giant plead guilty to fraud.

title: Israel Used Protocol That Put Civilians At Risk On October 7: Report
content: The Israel Defence Forces (IDF) used the 'Hannibal directive' during the Hamas attack on October 7, Haaretz, a leading daily, has reported. This directive allows soldiers to use force to prevent kidnappings, even if it puts the lives of hostages at r

title: Australian Man Arrested Over Children's Death In "Horrifying" Home Fire
content: Australian authorities have accused a Sydney father of trying to stop rescuers from saving his own family in a "horrifying" home fire that killed two boys and a baby girl.
summary: Australian authorities have accused a Sydney father of trying to stop rescuers from saving his own family in a "horrifying" home fire that killed two boys and a baby girl.

title: X Policy To Manually Review Users' DMs Sparks Concerns. Elon Musk Reacts
content: A policy update allowing the microblogging site X to manually review the direct messages (DMs) of some users has sparked major privacy concerns.
summary: A policy update allowing the microblogging site X to manually review the direct messages (DMs) of some users has sparked major privacy concerns.

title: World Bakes In Heatwaves As Temperatures Hit 13-Year June Record High
content: Last month was the hottest June on record, the EU's climate change monitoring service said on Monday, continuing a streak of exceptional temperatures that some scientists said puts 2024 on track to be the world's hottest recorded year.
summary: Last month was the hottest June on record, the EU's climate change monitoring service said on Monday, continuing a streak of exceptional temperatures that some scientists said puts 2024 on track to be the world's hottest recorded year.

title: France's Allies Relieved By Le Pen Loss But Worry About Messy Coalition
content: Many of France's allies breathed a sigh of relief that the worst was averted as Marine Le Pen's far-right failed to win a snap election on Sunday but they noted that a messy coalition from a hung parliament could also pose headaches for Europe.
summary: Many of France's allies breathed a sigh of relief that the worst was averted as Marine Le Pen's far-right failed to win a snap election on Sunday but they noted that a messy coalition from a hung parliament could also pose headaches for Europe.

title: "Lowest Of Low": Why Man Who Killed His Daughters Lives In Constant Fear
content: A Colorado man, who murdered his pregnant wife and two daughters in 2018, now lives in constant fear in prison. Chris Watts is terrified of being attacked or killed by prisoners disgusted by his heinous crime, reported the NY Post.
summary: A Colorado man, who murdered his pregnant wife and two daughters in 2018, now lives in constant fear in prison. Chris Watts is terrified of being attacked or killed by prisoners disgusted by his heinous crime, reported the NY Post.

title: X Manually Reviewing Users' Direct Messages? What Elon Musk Said
content: In a worrying trend, Elon Musk-owned X is manually reviewing certain users' direct messages (DMs) to investigate reported violations and misuse of its service, "or to comply with laws or governmental requests".
summary: In a worrying trend, Elon Musk-owned X is manually reviewing certain users' direct messages (DMs) to investigate reported violations and misuse of its service, "or to comply with laws or governmental requests".

title: Radio Host Who Claimed Joe Biden's Aides Provided Questions Leaves Station
content: In a one-minute video posted on Facebook on Sunday, Lawful-Sanders said, "effective immediately I am no longer an on-air host at WURD."
summary: In a one-minute video posted on Facebook on Sunday, Lawful-Sanders said, "effective immediately I am no longer an on-air host at WURD."

title: Key Figures To Know In France's Left-Wing New Popular Front Bloc
content: France's left-wing New Popular Front, an alliance of parties hastily assembled after President Emmanuel Macron called a surprise snap parliamentary election, looked set to score a shock win in Sunday's vote over the far right and the ruling centrists
summary: France's left-wing New Popular Front, an alliance of parties hastily assembled after President Emmanuel Macron called a surprise snap parliamentary election, looked set to score a shock win in Sunday's vote over the far right and the ruling centrists
